nodes.bodyText:
The description of the method could be tweaked as well. validateRegexs should be updated accordingly.
The empty should be lower case (same in the exception message).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -343,17 +343,18 @@ private static void validateRegexs(List<String> regexs) {
      * Validates that the given regular expression is not {@code null} nor invalid.
      *
      * @param regex the regular expression to be validated
-     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the regular expression is {@code null}.
+     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the regular expression is {@code null} or Empty.

nodes.bodyText:
We should not use exceptions for normal/common control flow (when we can avoid it, they are expensive to create). This should show the dialogue and return.
I'd suggest using other title (e.g. Duplicated Regular Expression) for the error and show without The provided regular expression is not valid:, seems unnecessary.
For consistency in what we accept/show we should also trim in performAction.
This lost the catch and error message, was that on purpose?
No.
It will have to set the list each time (same for modify), it might change after constructing the dialogue.
do i have to create new object each time or to create setRegexes method in the DialogAddRegex class ?
I'd go with the setter.
The new constructors could be reverted, they are no longer needed.

Done @thc202.
Good advice's, I hope doing more development with you in this project.
